issue.title: [BUG] UMAPINFO BossAction not working if MAPINFO also present
issue.body:
### GZDoom version

GZDoom 4.11.0

### Which game are you running with GZDoom?

Doom 2

### What Operating System are you using?

Windows 11

### Please describe your specific OS version

Windows 11 Home

### Relevant hardware info

_No response_

### Have you checked that no other similar issue already exists?

- [X] I have searched and not found similar issues.

### A clear and concise description of what the bug is.

I am currently making a GZDoom/complevel 21-compatible WAD that utilizes UMAPINFO. In the original (attached) WAD, a MAPINFO lump that was originally there as a fallback for compatibility with non-UM-supporting ports.
I am consistently unable to get bossaction to trigger, but only in GZDoom; Woof and DSDA-Doom do not have this issue.

While I have been trying to use this on monsters added via Dehacked, I have also reproduced it using stock Doom 2 actors. Incomplete version of the WAD attached.

Attempted with different compatibility settings, including Default, Doom (Strict) with MBF21 features enabled, and MBF with MBF21 features enabled. Also tested enabling and disabling the compatibility setting to enable bossdeath on any level, but that seemed to have no effect.

[DominusDWithBossBug.zip](https://github.com/ZDoom/gzdoom/files/12841548/DominusDWithBossBug.zip)

Removing the MAPINFO lump resolves the issue, and in the case of this WAD, is a viable option.

### Steps to reproduce the behaviour.

**Reproduction Steps**
1. Load attached WAD using compatibility settings that support MBF21.
2. Enter MAP30 using console/idclev/etc.
3. Kill Deh_Actor_152, either via console, mdk, or some other method. (Monster is still incomplete.)
4. Observe that sector 69 does not lower when the monster calls BossDeath, even though it does in other ports.

### Your configuration

_No response_

### Provide a Log

_No response_

### Please describe your specific OS version

Windows 11 Home

### Relevant hardware info

_No response_

### Have you checked that no other similar issue already exists?

- [X] I have searched and not found similar issues.

### A clear and concise description of what the bug is.

I am currently making a GZDoom/complevel 21-compatible WAD that utilizes UMAPINFO. In the original (attached) WAD, a MAPINFO lump that was originally there as a fallback for compatibility with non-UM-supporting ports.
I am consistently unable to get bossaction to trigger, but only in GZDoom; Woof and DSDA-Doom do not have this issue.

While I have been trying to use this on monsters added via Dehacked, I have also reproduced it using stock Doom 2 actors. Incomplete version of the WAD attached.

Attempted with different compatibility settings, including Default, Doom (Strict) with MBF21 features enabled, and MBF with MBF21 features enabled. Also tested enabling and disabling the compatibility setting to enable bossdeath on any level, but that seemed to have no effect.

[DominusDWithBossBug.zip](https://github.com/ZDoom/gzdoom/files/12841548/DominusDWithBossBug.zip)

Removing the MAPINFO lump resolves the issue, and in the case of this WAD, is a viable option.

3. Kill Deh_Actor_152, either via console, mdk, or some other method. (Monster is still incomplete.)
4. Observe that sector 69 does not lower when the monster calls BossDeath, even though it does in other ports.

### Your configuration

_No response_

### Provide a Log

_No response_

comment.body:
Yeah, unfortunately, the feature parity between UMAPINFO and MAPINFO isn't yet complete. I can't disable things like jumping or crouching via UMAPINFO, but I can't do things like define BossAction in MAPINFO.

Looks like ZMAPINFO is the best practice for this particular functionality, and this is working as designed. It would be nice to have GZDoom handle these conflicts the same way other ports do in the case of MAPINFO vs. UMAPINFO (though I do think ZMAPINFO should always take precedence, as it currently does), but as this is specifically intended, I'm going to close this as not a bug.

issue.title: GZDoom Linux Portable tar.xz builds are NOT running on recent stable Linux distributions
issue.body:
Tried with Debian 12 Bookworm and openSUSE Leap 15.5.

Debian just "Segmentation fault" with no further output; SUSE asks for glibc 2.35 at least, when Leap 15.5 ships glibc 2.31.

This is happening since release 4.11.1, curiously since @madame-rachelle took over the builds.
Something is definitely happening, which is not being acknowledged at all, and is giving a bad name...

release.name: GZDoom 4.11.3
release.body:
- [fix map WAD check for savegame validation.](https://github.com/ZDoom/gzdoom/commit/cecc836582d70109e512ff3dcf96cb47367731b5)
- [always save the map WAD in a savegame's metadata, even if it is from the IWAD](https://github.com/ZDoom/gzdoom/commit/cf160c1b18bdeac56b1f2b02b338fa0e245d7211) 
- [added Wads.GetLumpLength.](https://github.com/ZDoom/gzdoom/commit/6053842f7e027fb4070f77c640f27450b4f966f9)
release.short_description_html:
• fix map WAD check for savegame validation.
  • always save the map WAD in a savegame's metadata, even if it is from the IWAD
  • added Wads.GetLumpLength.

commits.message: fix map WAD check for savegame validation.

always save the map WAD in a savegame's metadata, even if it is from the IWAD

Otherwise the savegame loader will not be able to validate an IWAD savegame while the actual level comes from a different file.
added Wads.GetLumpLength.
- this is version 4.11.3

payload.description: GZDoom is a feature centric port for all Doom engine games, based on ZDoom, adding an OpenGL renderer and powerful scripting capabilities

commits.message: added Wads.GetLumpLength.

issue.title: [BUG] 4.11.2 cannot load vanilla (unmodded) savegames
issue.body:
### GZDoom version

GZDoom g4.11.2

### Which game are you running with GZDoom?

Doom 2

### What Operating System are you using?

Windows 11

### Please describe your specific OS version

Windows 11 Pro

### Relevant hardware info

_No response_

### Have you checked that no other similar issue already exists?

- [X] I have searched and not found similar issues.

### A clear and concise description of what the bug is.

Attempting to load a vanilla save-game (with no PWADs loaded) results in the message "This savegame needs these files:" (followed by nothing) printed into the console. The game then doesn't load and returns to the main menu.

### Steps to reproduce the behaviour.

1. Start a new, vanilla game (e.g. loading *only* DOOM2.WAD -- the actual IWAD is irrelevant). The "Lights", "Brightmaps" and "Widescreen" checkboxes can be checked or unchecked, it has no bearing on the issue.
2. Start a game and save it.
3. Exit GZDoom and restart it with the same vanilla game again.
4. Attempt to load the save file you have just created.
5. Observe that the save file is in yellow and prints the error message about needing "these files" to the console, with nothing in the specified file list.


### Your configuration

```ini
The bug occurs with the default configuration.
```


### Provide a Log

[log.txt](https://github.com/ZDoom/gzdoom/files/13171223/log.txt)

commits.message: fix map WAD check for savegame validation.

always save the map WAD in a savegame's metadata, even if it is from the IWAD

Otherwise the savegame loader will not be able to validate an IWAD savegame while the actual level comes from a different file.

pull_request.title: Savefix
pull_request.body:
Fixes #2228

The cause is obvious, but what I cannot see is how this could ever have worked before 4.11.2
While testing this I noticed that the savegame loader didn't reject a savegame for the IWAD's MAP01 while a PWAD with a different MAP01 is loaded. I fixed this as well.

issue.title: [BUG] 4.11.2 cannot load vanilla savegames
issue.body:
### GZDoom version

GZDoom g4.11.2

### Which game are you running with GZDoom?

Doom 2

### What Operating System are you using?

Windows 11

### Please describe your specific OS version

Windows 11 Pro

### Relevant hardware info

_No response_

### Have you checked that no other similar issue already exists?

- [X] I have searched and not found similar issues.

### A clear and concise description of what the bug is.

Attempting to load a vanilla save-game (with no PWADs loaded) results in the message "This savegame needs these files:" (followed by nothing) printed into the console. The game then doesn't load and returns to the main menu.

### Steps to reproduce the behaviour.

1. Start a new, vanilla game (e.g. loading *only* DOOM2.WAD -- the actual IWAD is irrelevant). The "Lights", "Brightmaps" and "Widescreen" checkboxes can be checked or unchecked, it has no bearing on the issue.
2. Start a game and save it.
3. Exit GZDoom and restart it with the same vanilla game again.
4. Attempt to load the save file you have just created.
5. Observe that the save file is in yellow and prints the error message about needing "these files" to the console, with nothing in the specified file list.


### Your configuration

```ini
The bug occurs with the default configuration.
```


### Provide a Log

[log.txt](https://github.com/ZDoom/gzdoom/files/13171223/log.txt)

commits.message: take most direct drawinfo references out of HWWall.

took several functions out of HWDrawInfo.

The only thing they needed from that class is the Level pointer and the light mode, this is better passed in as function argument.

release.name: GZDoom 4.11.2
release.body:
- [fixed savegame file name check.](https://github.com/ZDoom/gzdoom/commit/aa63cbcbdf4dd964dc4a434451c63631bd9353bb)
- [fixed savegame file name check.](https://github.com/ZDoom/gzdoom/commit/aa63cbcbdf4dd964dc4a434451c63631bd9353bb)
- [widen the special field in FBoomArgs.](https://github.com/ZDoom/gzdoom/commit/7bbe7a53e9a07e7dc66e03b54d4088a7d68f0cf4)
- [do not print all GL extensions to the log for the GLES renderer.](https://github.com/ZDoom/gzdoom/commit/66a904348bcb428826f597bc709e4053966f6537)
- [minor backend update from Raze.](https://github.com/ZDoom/gzdoom/commit/9355daacb0b764387761e1489c2412b615e846a1)
- [give error instead of warning for zscript 4.12+ on return count mismatch](https://github.com/ZDoom/gzdoom/commit/6aafc7f32363e236f5707068c34d0ae6d3ba1a10)
- [warn when fewer returns than expected are given for a function](https://github.com/ZDoom/gzdoom/commit/cba89e850a8db00718401972cc7d9c5b119bd84c)
release.short_description_html:
• fixed savegame file name check.
  • fixed savegame file name check.
  • widen the special field in FBoomArgs.
  • do not print all GL extensions to the log for the GLES renderer.
  • minor backend update from Raze.

payload.description: GZDoom is a feature centric port for all Doom engine games, based on ZDoom, adding an OpenGL renderer and powerful scripting capabilities

commits.message: - this is 4.11.2

fixed savegame file name check.

Writer and reader for the savegame metadata were mismatched so the readback of non-ASCII filenames failed.

fixed savegame file name check.

Writer and reader for the savegame metadata were mismatched so the readback of non-ASCII filenames failed.
- allow FORCEBACKCULLFACES to work with hud models
warn when fewer returns than expected are given for a function
give error instead of warning for zscript 4.12+ on return count mismatch
minor backend update from Raze.
do not print all GL extensions to the log for the GLES renderer.

widen the special field in FBoomArgs.

This code still assumed that all special types fit into 8 bits which is no longer the case.
fix UMAPINFO's intermusic being used at the summary screen.

issue.title: [BUG] Video intro can't be skipped and input is disabled if you do this
issue.body:
### GZDoom version

GZDoom 4.11.0

### Which game are you running with GZDoom?

Doom 2

### What Operating System are you using?

Windows 10

### Please describe your specific OS version

Windows 10 Pro

### Relevant hardware info

AMD Ryzen 5 1600, AMD Radeon RX 570

### Have you checked that no other similar issue already exists?

- [X] I have searched and not found similar issues.

### A clear and concise description of what the bug is.

So I created an .ivf video file and put it inside my project to play upon startup. Now if I launch GZDoom with my project and while it is loading I spam the escape key, the main menu activates, but the video keeps playing and you are unable to skip it or even navigate the menu. Basically, everything is stuck until the video ends. Only then can you navigate the menu again.

### Steps to reproduce the behaviour.

Explain how to reproduce
1. Create an .ivf video file (you can follow [this](https://forum.zdoom.org/viewtopic.php?t=76355) tutorial)
2. Create a .pk3 file that will contain the .ivf and the MAPINFO lump.
3. Launch the .pk3 you created with GZDoom and once it's loading keep pressing the escape button.
4. You should now see the main menu with the .ivf video playing in the background. Notice that you are unable to skip or navigate the menu until the video ends.


### Your configuration

_No response_

### Provide a Log

_No response_
